Text: The Kagenou family holdings.
Kagenou...
Sorry to keep you waiting.

We'll go the rest of the way on foot. At a dark
knight's pace, we will arrive by nightfall.
By nightfall?

We're headed beyond that mountain. Through the lands
of the therianthropes, and then deeper still.
But is that not their habitat?
He once visited this land and fought a Mist Dragon.

Once defeated, the dragon acknowledged him as master
of this land and heaved a sigh.

(So this phantasmal, bluish-purple mist is a dragon's
sigh...)
This mist is a deadly toxin.
A shiver runs through Rose's body.

That's why you must stay close. Stray too far from me
and you will die instantly.
I understand...

The two of them walk through the thick fog for a
while before coming to a clearing.
This is...
The ancient city of Alexandria... Our headquarters.
So this is the Shadow Garden...

The ancient city of Alexandria. Rose had seen the
name before in books.

However, what she sees now is beautiful in a way
that could never be properly conveyed in writing.

Expansive fields of crops she has never seen before
surround the city. There are also young women
harvesting the produce with zeal.
Lambda.
*gasp*
We have a new recruit. See to her training.
Aye.

Lambda is a dark-skinned elf with gray hair and gold
eyes. She is tall with refined muscles visible even
through her black bodysuit.
Her gaze is sharp, her lips full.
What comes next is up to you. Show us your strength.

Alpha turns, leaving Rose with the woman named
Lambda.
Number 664, Number 665!
Hm?
Instructor, you called?

Come. This is the new recruit. I'm putting her on
your squad.
Number 666!
That number is your name here.
Huh?!

Immediately, Rose's clothes are sliced from her
body. It only takes a fraction of a second.
Her naked form is visible for all to see.

From today on, you are nobody. Discard your name!
Abandon your clothes! Throw away everything so
you can become the perfect soldier!

A scrap of paper drifts from the remains of Rose's
garb, caught in the breeze.

It is the wrapper from the Tuna King sandwich Cid
had given her.

All of her bottled-up feelings for him begin gushing
out.
He had been her first love.

She faced him in a tournament, had her life saved by
him in the attack on the academy. Then there was
their trip, just the two of them. All of these precious
memories she could never replace.

Merely a week ago, Rose had even dared to dream that
they might get married.

But that is all lost to her now. She and Cid will
never cross paths again.
Aah...!
I told you to throw everything away.
The shreds of paper ride the wind off into the sky.

The last remnants of a dream that was never meant
to be.
Aaaaaah!
Heavy tears fall from Rose's eyes.
The underground temple.
Mission accomplished.

All goes as I will it to. I merely need lurk in the
darkness and accomplish what I set out to do.
The moment of awakening draws near.
As for the time that remains...
Yep,
I think I'll go with this next.
